titles.title: A concurrent resolution to express the sense of the Congress regarding the contributions of John Foster Dulles in international affairs.

calendar.text: Submitted in the Senate. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 577.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Called up by House Under Suspension of Rules.
Resolution Agreed to in House by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 3/3/1988--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that, on the centennial of the birth of statesman John Foster Dulles, Americans should examine his contributions in international affairs and study history to gain insight to meet challenges similar to those faced by him.
